MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000651
Special Investigation Intake Date: May 5, 2025
License #: CP630201334
Licensee Group Organization: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services
Licensee Designee: Demetrius Starling
Chief Administrator: Thomas Scheuer
Agency Name: OAKLAND COUNTY DHHS
Agency Address: 51111 WOODWARD AVE
PONTIAC, MI 48342-5037
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 12/05/2026
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
7/2/2025 2:30 PM Phone Interview
7/2/2025 1:30 PM Phone Interview
6/23/2025 10:00 AM Email Request for Interview
6/5/2025 2:45 PM Email Documentation received
5/15/2025 11:15 AM Phone Interview
5/6/2025 12:30 PM Email Special Investigation Initiation
1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule code CPA Rule 400.12214 Compliance with child protection law.
and Section • Rule 214. An agency shall comply with the child protection
Description law, 1975 PA 238, MCL 722.621 to 722.638
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
type
Allegation It is alleged that the agency failed to file a CPS complaint
regarding suspected abuse/neglect in a foster home.
Investigation DHHS Director was interviewed via telephone on 5/15/2025.
Director reported he was unaware of the case but would do some
research in an attempt to find case records. Director reported due
to the alleged abuse occurring over twenty years ago there may
not be any records. Director stated he would let this consultant
know what he finds.
An email from Director on 6/05/2025 informs that no records of the
case could be found.
Attempts to interview Complainant were made on 5/06/2025
and 6/23/2025. There was no response from Complainant.
Adoption Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on
7/02/2025. Adoption Supervisor is employed with another agency,
not Oakland County DHHS. Adoption Supervisor confirmed that
the agency she is employed with has licensed the foster home
where the alleged abuse occurred. The agency has licensed the
foster home of concern since 1994.
Licensing Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on
7/02/2025. Licensing Supervisor is employed by another agency,
not Oakland County DHHS. Licensing Supervisor confirmed that
the agency has licensed the foster home where the alleged abuse
occurred. The agency has licensed the foster home of concern
since 1994.
DOCUMENT REVIEW: A review of MISACWIS and CWLM
indicates the foster home where the alleged abuse occurred is not
licensed with Oakland County DHHS.
Analysis Oakland County DHHS has not licensed or provided services to
the foster home where the alleged abuse occurred.
2

Special Investigation #2025SIC0000839 has been opened on
the agency that licensed the foster home of concern.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
Section • (1) Upon receipt of any information that relates to possible
Description noncompliance with any foster home rule, the agency must
do all the following:
• (b) Initiate a special evaluation of the foster home as
soon as is indicated, based on the information
received, but not later than 7 calendar days after
receipt of the information.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that the agency failed to initiate a special evaluation
regarding alleged abuse/neglect in a foster home.
Investigation DHHS Director was interviewed via telephone on 5/15/2025.
Director reported he was unaware of the case but would do some
research in an attempt to find case records. Director reported that
due to the alleged abuse occurring over twenty years ago there
may not be any records. Director stated he would let this
consultant know what he finds.
An email from Director on 6/05/2025 informs that no records of the
case could be found.
Attempts to interview Complainant were made on 5/06/2025
and 6/23/2025. There was no response from the Complainant.
Adoption Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on
7/02/2025. Adoption Supervisor is employed with another agency,
not Oakland County DHHS. Adoption Supervisor confirmed that
the agency she is employed with has licensed the foster home
where the alleged abuse occurred. The agency has licensed the
foster home of concern since 1994.
Licensing Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on
7/02/2025. Licensing Supervisor is employed by another agency,
not Oakland County DHHS. Licensing Supervisor confirmed that
the agency has licensed the foster home where the alleged abuse
occurred. The agency has licensed the foster home of concern
since 1994.
3

DOCUMENT REVIEW: A review of MISACWIS and CWLM
indicates that the foster home where the alleged abuse occurred
is not licensed with Oakland County DHHS.
Analysis Oakland County DHHS has not licensed or provided services to
the foster home where the alleged abuse occurred.
Special Investigation #2025SIC0000839 has been opened on
the agency that licensed the foster home of concern.
Conclusion Violation Not Established.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
July 3, 2025
